org.ingatan.component.answerfield
Class AnsFieldList

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  org.ingatan.component.answerfield.AnsFieldList
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, IAnswerField
public class AnsFieldList
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements IAnswerField

BasicTextField answer field. At library manager time, takes a list of possible correct answers, and at quiz time it allows the user to enter some text.

Version:
1.o
Author:
Thomas Everingham
See Also:
Serialized Form

getDisplayName

public java.lang.String getDisplayName()
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
The user is presented with a palette of answer fields that may be added. This string is used as the display text for this answer field on the palette.

Specified by:
getDisplayName in interface IAnswerField
Returns:
the display text for this answer field.

isOnlyForAnswerArea

public boolean isOnlyForAnswerArea()
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
Gets whether or not this answer field can be added to the question and post-answer text areas, or if it should only be added to the answer text area of a flexi question. This is useful for creating answer fields that don't necessarily take answers, but are more for embedding data. One example is the audio answer field, used to embed audio data.

Note: Regardless of the value that this method returns, only answer fields in the answer text area will be counted when marking the question at quiz time. Answer fields in the question and post-answer areas will be ignored.

Specified by:
isOnlyForAnswerArea in interface IAnswerField
Returns:
true if this answer field can only be inserted into the answer text area of a flexi question and not into either the question or post-answer text, and false if this answer field can be inserted into any of the text areas of a flexi question container.

checkAnswer

public float checkAnswer()
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
This method looks at the answer provided by the user and compares it to the correct answer. The returned value should be a decimal percentage (i.e. 0 for 0%, 0.5 for 50%, 1.0 for 100%).

Specified by:
checkAnswer in interface IAnswerField
Returns:
the correctness of the given answer as a decimal percentage.

getMaxMarks

public int getMaxMarks()
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
Gets the maximum number of marks that can be awarded for this question. This may be preset, or there may be an interface as part of this answer field allowing the user to alter this.

Specified by:
getMaxMarks in interface IAnswerField
Returns:
the maximum number of marks that can be awarded for this question.

getMarksAwarded

public int getMarksAwarded()
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
Marks that have been awarded for the given answer. Depending on the implementation, this may be given by getMaxMarks() * checkAnswer().

Specified by:
getMarksAwarded in interface IAnswerField
Returns:
the number of marks awarded for the given answer. Returns 0 if no answer has yet been given.

displayOnly

public void displayOnly()
At edit time, if the display only checkbox is selected, then at quiz time this list will appear as a text list, uneditable and with all answers showing. This method creates that list.

displayCorrectAnswer

public void displayCorrectAnswer()
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
Display the correct answer(s) on the answer field. This should also make the answer field uneditable. This is used at quiz time during the post-answer stage so that the user can see what the answers should have been.

Specified by:
displayCorrectAnswer in interface IAnswerField

setContext

public void setContext(boolean inLibraryContext)
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
Sets whether the answer field is in the library manager or in quiz time. If in the library manager, the answer field should be editable, and allow the user to set the correct answer and possibly other options, depending on the answer field designer's requirements. When in the quiz time context, the answer field should allow the user to enter a possible answer, but not edit the answer field.

Specified by:
setContext in interface IAnswerField
Parameters:
inLibraryContext - true if the answer field currently exists within the library manager context.

writeToXML

public java.lang.String writeToXML()
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
Every AnswerField must be responsible for serialising itself. This string should contain all the information required to reconstruct the answer field by passing the string to the readInXML method.

The output of this method must not contain an opening or closing component tag as used by the Parser class.

Note: if this answer field saves an image based on the IOManager's methods, you will need to serialise using the imageID passed back. Every time the library is packaged, a clean-out of images is performed. The library file is searched and any image whose ID does not appear anywhere in the library file will be deleted. As a result, all image IDs must appear in the serialised String representation of the answer field. This will most likely be the case, but I have included this comment just in case.

Specified by:
writeToXML in interface IAnswerField
Returns:
the String representing the serialised answer field.

readInXML

public void readInXML(java.lang.String xml)
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
Every AnswerField must be able to reconstruct itself from the output of the writeToXML method. This method does this.

Specified by:
readInXML in interface IAnswerField
Parameters:
xml - the String to parse.

getParentLibraryID

public java.lang.String getParentLibraryID()
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
The library within which this answer field exists. This is important for the access of images. This is originally set when the answer field is added by the AnswerFieldPalette in the LibraryManagerWindow. It is then the AnswerField's responsibility to ensure that the value is serialised and de-serialised (thorugh write/readIn XML methods). If this functionality is not required (usually if you do not intend to save/load images) then simply set this method to return "".

Specified by:
getParentLibraryID in interface IAnswerField
Returns:
the ID of the library within which this answer field exists.

setParentLibraryID

public void setParentLibraryID(java.lang.String id)
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
Sets the library within which this answer field exists. This is important for the access of images. This is originally set when the answer field is added by the AnswerFieldPalette in the LibraryManagerWindow. It is then the AnswerField's responsibility to ensure that the value is serialised and de-serialised (thorugh write/readIn XML methods). If this functionality is not required (usually if you do not intend to save/load images) then simply set this method to return.

Specified by:
setParentLibraryID in interface IAnswerField
Parameters:
id - the ID of the library within which this answer field exists.

setQuizContinueListener

public void setQuizContinueListener(java.awt.event.ActionListener listener)
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
Sets the ActionListener for this answer field. This method will be called by the quiz window when the answer field is created. When the user interacts with the answer field in a way that should submit their answer, then the action listener should have its actionPerformed method fired with an ActionEvent that contains the source of the event (i.e. the answer field object). This will tell the QuizWindow that the user has submitted the answer. An example is the user pressing enter when in a text field, or double clicking a multiple choice option.

Note: if the answer field is the only one for the current question, firing the actionPerformed method of this listener will be the equivalent of the user pressing the 'Continue' button at quiz time. If there are other answer fields present, then all that occurs is that the focus is shifted to the next answer field in the area.

Note: When calling the actionPerformed method of this listener, ensure that your hot key does not conflict with the Shift+Enter or Ctrl+Enter hot keys of the QuizWindow. For example:

if ((e.getKeyCode == KeyEvent.VK_ENTER) && (e.getModifiers == 0)) {
listener.actionPerformed(new ActionEvent(AnsField.this,0,""));
}

will ensure that the actionPerformed method will only occur if the enter key is pressed. The modifiers=0 condition ensures that the actionPerformed method is only called if the neither the control nor shift key is down. This respects the QuizWindow hotkeys. Also ensure that Ctrl+S is not used.

Specified by:
setQuizContinueListener in interface IAnswerField
Parameters:
listener - the ActionListener set by the QuizWindow for this answer field instance.

resaveImagesAndResources

public void resaveImagesAndResources(java.lang.String lib)
Description copied from interface: IAnswerField
This method is called upon any event where the answer field may have changed ownership. Examples include copying the answer field and pasting it into another library's text field, or copying an entire question and pasting it into another library.

This method should resave all images/files that are being used by the answer field. This method will be called before the setParentLibraryID method has been called, so you can be confident to use your value for parent library ID as the source libraryID. If your answer field does not use external resources such as images or other files, then you can ignore this method.

To save images, use: IOManager.copyImage(sourceLibraryID, sourceImageID, destinationLibraryID)
To save files, use: IOManager.saveResource(sourceLibraryID, sourceResourceID, destinationLibraryID)

NOTE: Ensure that you use the new resource/imageID returned by these methods when seralising the answer field, as they may have changed. You do not need to store newLibraryID, as the setParentLibraryID method is called directly after the resaveImagesAndResources method.

Specified by:
resaveImagesAndResources in interface IAnswerField
